required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Joint Effusion on Quadriceps Muscle
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Joint Effusion on Quadriceps Muscle in Patients With Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: The present study investigated whether the presence of fluid in the joint affected peak torque and the root mean square (RMS) values of surface electromyography (EMG) in patients symptomatic for osteoarthritis (OA).

detailed_description.textblock: Several studies have shown that knee effusion influenced quadriceps muscle activity and induced quadriceps arthrogenic muscle inhibition in normal volunteers. However, the effect of joint effusion on the quadriceps of patients with OA is controversial,and few patients with OA have been included in studies of joint effusion.

primary_outcome.measure: the peak torque of the knee extensors
primary_outcome.description: to evaluate the effect of effusion on the peak torque of the knee extensors

secondary_outcome.measure: the root mean square values of the vastus medialis and vastus lateralis muscles
secondary_outcome.description: to evaluate the effect of effusion on the RMS of the vastus medialis (VM) and vastus lateralis (VL) muscles

arm_group.description: 20 cc normal saline injection into the knee joint

intervention.description: 20 cc normal saline injection into knee joint

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 50 years old or older with knee osteoarthritis
- knee pain without joint effusion confirmed by ultrasonography
Exclusion Criteria:
- the presence of knee joint effusion determined using US
- a history of knee injury or surgery
- a history of knee injection within 3 months
- a history of inflammatory arthritis
- taking anticoagulants
- balance or gait disturbance
- diabetes mellitus

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Rehabilitation Medicine, Seoul St. Mary's Hospital, College of Medicine, The Catholic University of Korea

facility.name: Department of Rehabilitation Medicine, Seoul St. Mary's Hospital, College of Medicine, The Catholic University of Korea
